Trace the end-to-end flow of `POST /api/referrals` from request validation to DB writes and response.
Explain how idempotency is applied in referral creation and what is cached on success vs failure.

Explain unsubscribe flow including token handling and suppression updates.

Given the current architecture, propose a robust strategy to prevent duplicate referral emails during transient failures.
Assess likely bottlenecks when scaling from ~400 to 5,000 members and propose prioritized mitigations.
Design an approach for observability (metrics/logging/tracing) across API routes and services with minimal code churn.
Evaluate security risks in the token format and suggest hardening changes while preserving compatibility.
Propose a rollout plan for contact-groups + messaging that minimizes migration risk and production downtime.
Identify ambiguous ownership boundaries between actions and API routes; propose a cleaner contract.
Recommend a test strategy to detect auth regressions across DAL, route handlers, and protected pages.

Evaluate whether idempotency storage should be per-route/per-user/global; propose a schema and expiration policy.
Design a policy for handling partial failures when email send succeeds but DB transaction fails (and vice versa).
Propose a data retention/deletion workflow to meet future compliance requirements documented in architecture docs.
Recommend a safe strategy to move from HMAC-short-signature tokens to a stronger auth scheme.
Assess where SSR/CSR boundaries may leak sensitive data and suggest code-level guardrails.
Given current tests, identify highest-risk untested behaviors and propose the next 5 high-value test cases.
Propose a deterministic contract test suite for external member API integration under network failures.
Design a migration approach for upcoming contact-group models that preserves existing referral functionality.
Evaluate ambiguity in error code semantics and propose a normalized error taxonomy across services/routes.
Propose a strategy to validate citation grounding quality for responses generated from this repository.
Recommend a plan to benchmark and improve p95 latency on referral creation without weakening safeguards.
If product requirements conflict (security vs UX vs speed), propose a principled decision framework for this codebase.
